intro: Cupania howeana, commonly known as the Howean cupania, is a tropical plant native to the Pacific Islands. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several small, hard seeds. Cupania howeana is often found in moist, shaded areas within tropical forests.
